page.title: 19Communications- The Future
page.content: Because of the ever present dangers to the Methane Terminal and Oil Storage Depot sited along the riverside coast of{Canvey}as well as the need for another means of exit in case of an evacuation of the population, a new road - an extension to the A130 to{Chelmsford}was built in 1972/73. The land to the West of Long Road/Canvey Road is a large privately owned marshland pasture, used for cattle grazing. It was over this land that the much needed second access road to{Canvey}was built. The A130 crosses the Benfleet Creek and the rail line to London and joins the A13 to London, Texaco oil tankers use this road. As a single carriage way road it has provided somewhat inadequate for the volume of traffic using it, so a double carriage way is planned.
